description: Single-storey rear/infill extension; refurbishment of brickwork and window joinery involving repointing or replacement of defective bricks with matching second-hand bricks; alterations to rear garden involving replacement of concrete surface in rear garden with reclaimed York stone paving and 1.9m high timber fence with 0.6m trellis on side boundary with matching fence; alteration to front garden involving replacement of red quarry tiles with reclaimed York stone paving and replanting of deceased hedge; and internal alterations involving removal and erection of partition walls, installation of arch and cornice, blocking up of cupboard and doorways, rehanging of two doors, installation of drawers and hanging rails, modernisation of kitchen, and replacement of windows with matching double doors to form opening (Listed Building Consent)
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

REASON: To comply with the provisions of Section 18(1) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 (As Amended) to prevent the accumulation of unimplemented Listed Building Consents and to enable the Local Planning Authority to review the situation at the end of this period if the development has not begun. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the drawing titles: A657/20; A657/21; A657/22; A657/L1; A657/PL01 Rev. A; and A657/PL02 Rev. A.

REASON: For avoidance of doubt and in the interest of proper planning. | All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building and shall be consistent with those as listed within the submitted application form and the drawings / plans as listed in Condition 2.

REASON: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the existing building and surrounding area in accordance with the Bedford Park Conservation Area Management Plan (2007), as well as, policies 7.4, 7.6 and 7.8 of the London Plan (2016); 1.1 and 1.2 of the Local Development Framework (Core) Strategy (2012); and 7B, 7C and 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan 2013. | Any damage to the building caused by or during the course of the carrying out of the works permitted shall be made good within three months of the completion of the development, in accordance with a specification agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority.

REASON: To safeguard the character and appearance of the Listed building in accordance with policies 7.8 of the London Plan (2016); 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012); and 7C of the adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan (2013).
